intro: Acleisanthes greggii, commonly known as Gregg's morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and violet. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a velvety texture. Acleisanthes greggii is a perennial vine that blooms in the spring and is often found in desert or arid environments.
